celebrity.headline: Taylor Swift Breaks Silence on Vienna Concert Cancellations
celebrity.summary: Taylor Swift addressed the cancellation of her Vienna concerts due to a thwarted terrorist threat, expressing her devastation for fans. She thanked authorities for their swift action to ensure safety.

celebrity.headline: Ben Affleck and Jennifer Lopez Divorce Rumors Intensify
celebrity.summary: Speculation about Ben Affleck and Jennifer Lopez's marriage continues as the couple has reportedly been spending time apart. Sources claim they are focusing on individual projects amid personal challenges.

celebrity.headline: Adele Confirms Engagement to Rich Paul
celebrity.summary: Adele announced her engagement to sports agent Rich Paul during a concert in Munich, showing off her ring to the audience. Fans cheered as she shared her excitement about the milestone.

celebrity.headline: Ryan Reynolds Talks Deadpool & Wolverine Success
celebrity.summary: Ryan Reynolds celebrated the massive box office success of 'Deadpool & Wolverine,' thanking fans for their support. The film has broken multiple records since its release.

celebrity.headline: Beyoncé to Perform at Democratic National Convention
celebrity.summary: Rumors are swirling that Beyoncé will perform at the Democratic National Convention in Chicago to support Kamala Harris. No official confirmation has been made yet.

legal.headline: Supreme Court Rejects Missouri’s Bid to Delay Trump Sentencing
legal.summary: The U.S. Supreme Court denied Missouri's request to delay sentencing in Donald Trump's hush money case. This decision keeps the legal proceedings on track in New York.

legal.headline: Hunter Biden Tax Case Verdict Delayed
legal.summary: A federal judge delayed the verdict in Hunter Biden's tax evasion case to consider a motion for dismissal. The case involves allegations of failing to report income from foreign dealings.

legal.headline: Google Loses Antitrust Case Over Search Dominance
legal.summary: A federal judge ruled that Google violated antitrust laws by maintaining an illegal monopoly in online search. This landmark decision could reshape the tech industry.

legal.headline: Alec Baldwin ‘Rust’ Case Dismissal Upheld
legal.summary: A judge upheld the dismissal of involuntary manslaughter charges against Alec Baldwin in the 'Rust' shooting case. Prosecutors had withheld key evidence, leading to the dismissal.

legal.headline: FTX Founder Sam Bankman-Fried Sentencing Update
legal.summary: Sam Bankman-Fried, founder of FTX, awaits sentencing updates after being convicted of fraud and money laundering. The case has drawn significant attention to cryptocurrency regulation.

topUS.headline: Kamala Harris Secures Democratic Nomination for President
topUS.summary: Vice President Kamala Harris officially secured the Democratic nomination for president after a virtual roll call vote. She will face Donald Trump in the November election.

topUS.headline: Hurricane Debby Makes Landfall in Florida
topUS.summary: Hurricane Debby struck Florida’s Big Bend region as a Category 1 storm, bringing heavy rain and flooding. Authorities warn of life-threatening storm surges in affected areas.

topUS.headline: Stock Markets Plunge Amid Recession Fears
topUS.summary: U.S. and global stock markets experienced sharp declines due to fears of an impending recession. Investors are reacting to weak economic data and geopolitical tensions.

topUS.headline: U.S. Sends More Troops to Middle East Amid Tensions
topUS.summary: The U.S. is deploying additional troops to the Middle East as tensions escalate following recent attacks. The Pentagon aims to bolster regional security and deter further violence.

topUS.headline: COVID-19 Cases Rise Again in Several States
topUS.summary: A summer surge of COVID-19 cases has been reported in multiple U.S. states, prompting renewed health warnings. Officials urge vaccination and mask-wearing in high-risk areas.

athensOH.headline: Athens County Fair Kicks Off with Record Attendance
athensOH.summary: The annual Athens County Fair opened with a record number of attendees enjoying livestock shows and carnival rides. Organizers expect the event to draw thousands over the week.

athensOH.headline: Ohio University Announces New Sustainability Initiative
athensOH.summary: Ohio University unveiled a new plan to reduce campus carbon emissions by 50% by 2030. The initiative includes energy-efficient upgrades and student-led projects.

athensOH.headline: Local Business Owners Protest Proposed Zoning Changes
athensOH.summary: Athens business owners rallied against proposed zoning changes that could limit commercial development. They argue the changes threaten economic growth in the area.

athensOH.headline: Athens City Council Approves New Bike Lane Project
athensOH.summary: The Athens City Council voted to fund a new bike lane project to improve cyclist safety on major roads. Construction is set to begin next spring.

athensOH.headline: Community Garden Expands with Grant Funding
athensOH.summary: A local community garden in Athens received a grant to expand its plots and offer free workshops. The project aims to promote sustainable farming practices.

mariettaOH.headline: Marietta Riverfront Project Nears Completion
mariettaOH.summary: The Marietta Riverfront revitalization project is almost finished, featuring new walkways and event spaces. Officials hope it will boost tourism along the Ohio River.

mariettaOH.headline: Washington-Morgan Community Action Receives Funding Boost
mariettaOH.summary: Washington-Morgan Community Action secured additional funding to support low-income families in Marietta. Programs will focus on housing and job training assistance.

mariettaOH.headline: Marietta City Schools Prepare for New Academic Year
mariettaOH.summary: Marietta City Schools are finalizing preparations for the upcoming school year with updated safety protocols. Back-to-school events are scheduled for late August.

mariettaOH.headline: Local Festival Celebrates Marietta’s History
mariettaOH.summary: The annual Marietta History Festival drew crowds with reenactments and local crafts over the weekend. The event highlighted the city’s role in early American history.

mariettaOH.headline: New Business Opens in Downtown Marietta
mariettaOH.summary: A new boutique opened in downtown Marietta, aiming to attract shoppers with locally made goods. City officials welcomed the addition as a boost to the local economy.

parkersburgWV.headline: Parkersburg City Council Debates Budget Cuts
parkersburgWV.summary: Parkersburg City Council members discussed potential budget cuts to address a shortfall in municipal funds. Public services may face reductions if no solution is found.

parkersburgWV.headline: Local Park Renovation Project Underway
parkersburgWV.summary: A major renovation of City Park in Parkersburg began this week, including new playground equipment. The project is funded by a combination of grants and donations.

parkersburgWV.headline: Parkersburg High School Wins State Robotics Competition
parkersburgWV.summary: Parkersburg High School’s robotics team took first place at a statewide competition, earning national recognition. The team will compete at the national level next month.

parkersburgWV.headline: Flood Recovery Efforts Continue in Parkersburg
parkersburgWV.summary: Residents and officials in Parkersburg are still recovering from recent flooding along the Ohio River. Community volunteers are assisting with cleanup and rebuilding efforts.

parkersburgWV.headline: New Art Exhibit Opens at Parkersburg Art Center
parkersburgWV.summary: The Parkersburg Art Center debuted a new exhibit featuring works by local artists this weekend. The exhibit will run through the end of September.
